member.name: T:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames
member.summary: Provides common HTML meta-tag names.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Abstract
member.summary: The "abstract" tag. Define a secondary description.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Author
member.summary: The "author" tag. Records the name of the author of the document.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Classification
member.summary: The "classification" tag. Classify the site into the appropriate category.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Copyright
member.summary: The "copyright" tag. Used to include copyright information in the document.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Description
member.summary: The "description" tag. Some search engines pick up this description to show with the results of searches.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Distribution
member.summary: The "distribution" tag. Declares whether a document is available to the web or on an intranet. Possible content values are "Global", "Local", "IU".

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.DocClass
member.summary: The "doc-class" tag. Indicates completion status of document. Possible values are "Completed", "Draft", "Living Document", "Published".

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.DocRights
member.summary: The "doc-rights" tag. Indicates copyright status of document. Possible values are "Copywritten Work", "Private", "Public", "Public Domain".

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.DocType
member.summary: The "doc-type" tag. Specifies type of document. Possible content values are "Confidential Company Papers", "eZine", "Government", "Journal", "Manuscript", "Paper", "Private", "Public", "Web Page", "White Paper".

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Expires
member.summary: The "expires" tag. Expiration date of the document.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Generator
member.summary: The "generator" tag. The name of the program that created the document.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Googlebot
member.summary: The "googlebot" tag. Define pages to be excluded from googebot indexing. Possible content values are "all", "index, follow", "noindex, follow", "index, nofollow", "noindex, nofollow", "none", "nosnippet", "noarchive".

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Keywords
member.summary: The "keywords" tag. Inform search engines what your web site or page is about.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.MSSmartTagsPreventParsing
member.summary: The "MSSmartTagsPreventParsing" tag. Use this tag to prevent any Microsoft product from automatically generating smart tags. Possible content value is "TRUE".

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Owner
member.summary: The "owner" tag. Define the owner of the page or site.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.ProgId
member.summary: The "progid" tag.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Rating
member.summary: The "rating" tag. A simple rating for a site.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Refresh
member.summary: The "refresh" tag. Indicates the document displays for a specified amount of time before switching to a new URL. The content value should be in the format "n;url", where "n" is the number of seconds to wait before loading the URL specified by "url".

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.ReplyTo
member.summary: The "reply-to" tag. Email address of contact for document.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.ResourceType
member.summary: The "resource-type" tag. Indicates the type of web resource. Possible content value is "document".

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.RevisitAfter
member.summary: The "revisit-after" tag. Defines how often search engine spiders should revisit your site.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.HtmlExporterBase.MetaTagNames.Robots
member.summary: The "robots" tag. Defines pages to be excluded from robot indexing. Possible values are "all", "index, follow", "noindex, follow", "index, nofollow", "noindex, nofollow", "none", "noimageindex".

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.Lexer.CellRef
member.summary: Recognizes a cell reference.
member.remarks: Valid cell references include: Numbers only: 1,2,.. (currently NOT supported) Letters only: A,B,.. (currently NOT supported) Numbers and letters combinations: A1,AC3,BD11,.. All of the above prefixed by $ sign: $1,$A,$A1,A$1,$A$1,.. Also recognizes references in the R1C1-style format.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.GridView.GetPreviousHRun(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Cell)
member.summary: Returns a cell in the same row as the specified cell, based on the following criteria. If the specified cell contains data, searches to the left for a cell that contains data, and its left neighbor does not contain data, that is, searches for the first data cell in the sequence. If the specified cell does not contain data or is the first cell in the sequence, returns the previous cell with data in this row.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.GridView.GetNextHRun(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Cell)
member.summary: Returns a cell in the same row as the specified cell, based on the following criteria. If the specified cell contains data, searches to the right for a cell that contains data, and its right neighbor does not contain data, that is, searches for the last data cell in the sequence. If the specified cell does not contain data or is the last cell in the sequence, returns the next cell with data in this row.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.GridView.GetPreviousVRun(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Cell)
member.summary: Returns a cell in the same column as the specified cell, based on the following criteria. If the specified cell contains data, searches up for a cell that contains data, and its top neighbor does not contain data, that is, searches for the first data cell in the sequence. If the specified cell does not contain data or is the first cell in the sequence, returns the previous cell with data in this column.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.GridView.GetNextVRun(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Cell)
member.summary: Returns a cell in the same column as the specified cell, based on the following criteria. If the specified cell contains data, searches down for a cell that contains data, and its bottom neighbor does not contain data, that is, searches for the last data cell in the sequence. If the specified cell does not contain data or is the last cell in the sequence, returns the next cell with data in this column.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.GridView.ProcessNavigation(System.Windows.Forms.Keys,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Modifies the current selection and active cell based on the specified user input. This method could eventually raise the RequestWorksheet event in response to CTRL + one of the page keys. Returns true if the active cell or the current selection have been changed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.GridView.SelectLeft(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Cell,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRef,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Cell@)
member.summary: Modifies the specified range as if the specified cell is the currently active cell and the user pressed the LEFT arrow key while optionally holding down the SHIFT or CTRL keys. This method does not change the currently active cell nor the current selection. The method however ensures that the new active cell or selected range is visible in the view. The newActiveCell parameter receives the new active cell and the resulting range is returned by the method.

The newActiveCell parameter receives the new active cell and the resulting range is returned by the method.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.GridView.SelectPageUp(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Cell,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRef)
member.summary: Modifies the specified range as if the specified cell is the currently active cell and the user pressed the PAGEUP key. If the specified range is an actual range and the active cell is not at the bottom of the range, the selection is actually collapsed from the bottom side. This method does not change the current selection. The method however ensures that the new selected range is visible in the view. The resulting range is returned by the method.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.ColumnRange.Group
member.summary: Increases the outline level of all columns in the range.

member.summary: Decreses the outline level of all columns in the range.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.ColumnRange.Style
member.summary: Gets an IColumnStyle object that can be used to customize the appearance of all columns in the range.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.ColumnRange.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of all columns in the range.
member.remarks: If the columns have different or default widths, this property returns null.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.ColumnRange.IsHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the columns in the range are hidden.
member.remarks: If the columns have different or default values, this property returns null.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.ColumnRange.OutlineLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the outline level of the columns in the range.
member.remarks: If the columns have different or default values, this property returns null.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.ColumnRange.Validation
member.summary: Gets an IValidation object that can be used to specify validation rules for the data in the range.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.ColumnRange.ConditionalFormats
member.summary: Gets a list with format objects that can be used to customize the appearance of the columns in the range based on various conditions.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.ColumnRange.Left
member.summary: Gets the left column of the range.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.ColumnRange.Right
member.summary: Gets the right column of the range.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Worksheet.Copy(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook)
member.summary: Copies this worksheet to the specified workbook.
member.param: The workbook to copy to.
member.returns: true if the copy was successful; otherwise, false. The method returns false if the workbook contains a worksheet with the same name.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Worksheet.Copy(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies this worksheet to the specified workbook at the specified index.
member.param: The workbook to copy to.
The 0-based index in the target workbook where to copy this worksheet, or -1, to copy at the end of the workbook.
member.returns: true if the copy was successful; otherwise, false. The method returns false if the workbook contains a worksheet with the same name.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Worksheet.Copy(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Copies this worksheet to the specified workbook at the specified index.

The 0-based index in the target workbook where to copy this worksheet, or -1, to copy at the end of the workbook.
The new name of copied the worksheet.
member.returns: true if the copy was successful; otherwise, false. The method returns false if the workbook contains a worksheet with the same name.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Worksheet.AutoFilterMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether there is an active autofilter in the worksheet.
member.remarks: This property can be set to false to turn autofiltering off, but cannot be set to true. To enable autofiltering, call the AutoFilter method of the CellRange class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.Find(System.String,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Cell,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.FindWithin,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.LookIn,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.SearchOrder,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.SearchDirection,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a search for a cell containing the specified text, using the specified criteria.
member.param: The text to search.
The cell to start the search from.
The target of the search - the referenced worksheet or the entire workbook.
Specifies whether to search in the cell's formula or value.
The search order - horizontal or vertical.
The search direction - forward or backward.
Specifies whether the search should be case-sensitive.
Specifies whether to match entire cells only.
member.returns: A Cell object representing the found cell, or null, if the text was not found.

member.summary: Finds and returns all cells containing the specified text, using the specified criteria.
member.param: The text to search.
The worksheet to search.
The target of the search - the specified worksheet or the entire workbook.
Specifies whether to search in the cell's formula or value.
The search order - horizontal or vertical.
The search direction - forward or backward.
Specifies whether the search should be case-sensitive.
Specifies whether to match entire cells only.
member.returns: An enumerable containing the found cells.

member.summary: Replaces the data of the specified cell if it matches the specified criteria and returns the next matching cell.
member.param: The text to search and replace.
The value to replace with.
The cell containing the data to replace.
The target of the replace operation - the referenced worksheet or the entire workbook.
The replace order - horizontal or vertical.
The replace direction - forward or backward.
Specifies whether the match should be case-sensitive.
Specifies whether to match entire cells only.
member.returns: A Cell object representing the next matching cell, or null, if the text was not found or if the specified cell does not match.

The text to replace with.
The worksheet to search.

member.returns: A TrackChangesCommand that is used to track the changes, or null, if undo is disabled.

member.summary: Stops tracking changes by the specified command and reverts all changes done so far.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.CommitChangeOperation(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.TrackChangesCommand)
member.summary: Stops tracking changes by the specified command and saves the command in the history queue.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.StartCompositeOperation
member.summary: Starts recording undo/redo commands into a CompositeCommand.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.CancelCompositeOperation
member.summary: Stops recording the most recently started composite operation and discards the records created so far.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.CommitCompositeOperation
member.summary: Stops recording the most recently started composite operation and saves the composite in the history queue.

member.summary: Gets the workbook defined default numeric formats.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.CanUndo
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether there is a command in the undo history which can be undone.
member.value: true if the undo queue contains operations that can be undone; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.CanRedo
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether there is a command in the undo history which can be redone.
member.value: true if the undo queue contains operations that can be redone; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.UndoEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether saving action records for later undo is enabled.
member.value: true to save actions for later undo; otherwise false. The default is false.
member.remarks: To undo the last recorded action, call the Undo method. It can be redone again by calling Redo. Custom operations can be integrated into the MindFusion.Spreadsheet undo/redo system by deriving from the Command class and running the operations by means of the ExecuteCommand method.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.ExtendedEvaluator
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom expression evaluator. Identifier and function calls that cannot be resolved by the core are delegated to this evaluator.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.CoreInformationProvider
member.summary: Gets the information provider for the built-in functions.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.ExtendedInformationProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets an information provider for custom functions.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.CalculationMaxIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of iterations when calculating certain functions, such as IRR and RATE.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.CalculationPrecision
member.summary: Gets or sets the precision when calculating certain functions, such as IRR and RATE.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.EnableFormulaEvaluation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether formula evaluation is enabled.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.EnableTypeInference
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether cell data is automatically interpreted as a value of a specific type, or accepted as text.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.ActionRedone
member.summary: Raised when an action is redone.
member.remarks: This event is raised during calls to Redo. It is raised both for top-level commands and for the constituent actions of composite commands.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook.ActionUndone
member.summary: Raised when an action is undone.
member.remarks: This event is raised during calls to Undo. It is raised both for top-level commands and for the constituent actions of composite commands.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.DeviceContext.SelectFont(System.String,System.Double,System.Drawing.FontStyle)
member.summary: Selects a font with the specified attributes in the underlying device context for subsequent painting/measuring. If the currently selected font is identical with a font with the specified attributes, nothing happens. If the font cache already contains a font with the specified attributes this cached font is reused.

member.summary: Gets a list with all selected cell ranges.

member.remarks: If there is more than one selected cell range, this property returns the first range.

member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the view.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Workbook displayed in the view.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display the active cell.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display the range affected by the autofilter.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the horizontal scrollbar.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the vertical scrollbar.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tabs are visible.

member.summary: Gets or sets the tabs alignment.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display a close button for each tab.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tab navigation buttons.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display the 'Create New Tab' button.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether tabs can be rearranged interactively.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether tabs can be in-place edited.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display the grid lines.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.WorkbookView.DrawFilledCellBorders
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to draw the default grid lines for cells with set background.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.WorkbookView.AllowAutoFill
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display the auto-fill handle at the bottom-right side of the selection.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.WorkbookView.AutoFillCopyOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the auto-fill tool should only copy values, instead of extrapolating new values from the selection.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.WorkbookView.AllowMoveHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can interactively move the worksheet headers, by selecting the entire column or row and dragging.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.WorkbookView.AllowMoveCells
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can interactively move cells around the worksheet, by pressing near the edge of the currently selected cells with the mouse and dragging.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.WorkbookView.ShowScrollToolTips
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display tooltips when scrolling with the thumb.

member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the tooltip that is displayed when the view is scrolled horizontally.

member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the tooltip that is displayed when the view is scrolled vertically.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display tooltips when the user resizes row or column headers.

member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the tooltip that is displayed when a column is resized interactively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.WorkbookView.ResizeRowToolTipFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the tooltip that is displayed when a row is resized interactively.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display indicators for hidden row and column headers.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users can resize rows and columns by dragging cell borders.

member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the row header, or null, to automatically size the row headers.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Cell.SetData(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the data of the cell, represented by this object.
member.param: The new data of the cell.
If value represents a formula, this is the column offset of all relative cell references. Otherwise, this value is ignored.
If value represents a formula, this is the row offset of all relative cell references. Otherwise, this value is ignored.
member.remarks: If value is a string, starting with an equal sign '=', it is interpreted as a formula. To specify a string, starting with an equal sign as cell data, prefix the string with a single apostrophe '''. The parameters dcolumn and drow can be used to offset all relative cell references in the formula. For example, the following call SetData("=A1", 1, 2) will actually set the formula "=B3" as data in the cell.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Cell.SetData(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the data of the cell, represented by this object.
member.param: The new data of the cell.
If value represents a formula, this is the column offset of all relative cell references. Otherwise, this value is ignored.
If value represents a formula, this is the row offset of all relative cell references. Otherwise, this value is ignored.
true to interpret the specified data as a culture-invariant; false to interpret it in the context of the worksheet's locale.
member.remarks: If value is a string, starting with an equal sign '=', it is interpreted as a formula. To specify a string, starting with an equal sign as cell data, prefix the string with a single apostrophe '''. The parameters dcolumn and drow can be used to offset all relative cell references in the formula. For example, the following call SetData("=A1", 1, 2) will actually set the formula "=B3" as data in the cell.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.FunctionCallNode.IsInvariant
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this node represents an invariant function. Invariant functions have reference parameters, but do not evaluate them and as such, are not able to induce dependency cycles.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.FunctionCallNode.IsVolatile
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this node represents a volatile function. Volatile functions may return different values in subsequent calls with the same arguments.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.FunctionCallNode.IsDynamic
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this node represents a dynamic function. Dynamic functions are volatile functions that return Reference objects. In other words, expressions containing dynamic functions may change their dependencies when evaluated.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.FunctionCallNode.IsCustom
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this node represents a custom function.

member.summary: Gets the name of the function represented by this node in its original casing.

member.summary: Gets the name of the function in upper case.

member.summary: Represents a command that implements the IDisposable interface.
member.remarks: A DisposableCommand is automatically committed when disposed unless it has been already executed or cancelled.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DisposableCommand class.

member.summary: IDisposable.Dispose implementation.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.DisposableCommand.Clean
member.summary: Disposes of this command.
member.remarks: This method is guaranteed to be invoked when the command is either disposed of or executed directly without subsequently disposed of. This method is guaranteed to be invoked only once, that is, if a command is executed and then disposed of, this method is invoked only once. This method is not automatically invoked when the command is cancelled (undone) to prevent cleaning when Undo is invoked by the undo manager.

The column of the top-left cell of the initial range.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.NamedRange.OnPropertyValueChanged(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.PropertyEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the PropertyValueChanged event.
member.param: An object providing the event data.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.NamedRange.IsValidName(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the specified value is a valid NamedRange name.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.NamedRange.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the named range.
member.remarks: The name of a named range must be unique (ignoring case) amongst all named ranges in a Workbook. It must not be a valid cell or cell range reference (for example, A1). It needs to be a proper identifier, that is, it must start with a letter and contain only letters, numbers and underscore characters. Lastly, the name must not coincide with the built-in identifiers 'true' and 'false'. If any of these requirements are violated, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.NamedRange.CellRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the cell or range of cells associated with this named range.
member.remarks: Specifying an invalid or incomplete cell range will throw an exception. A cell range without sheet name is considered incomplete.

member.summary: Gets the name of the worksheet represented by this named range.

member.summary: Raised when a property of this object is changed.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Charts.Chart.SetDataSource(System.String,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Charts.PlotBy,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Sets the chart data source to the specified range of cells.
member.param: A string specifying a range of cells or an expression which evaluates to a range of cells.
A flag specifying whether the series are created from the columns or from the rows in the specified range.

A flag specifying whether to use the values in the first column of the specified range as labels, or null, to attempt to automatically determine this based on the type of the data. This parameter is ignored by some charts that do not display labels.

A flag specifying whether to use the values in the first row of the specified range as labels, or null, to attempt to automatically determine this based on the type of the data. This parameter is ignored by some charts that do not display labels.
member.returns: true if the data source was successfully set; false if the specified string does not identify a range of cells.
member.remarks: The changes caused by this method are automatically recorded for subsequent undo, therefore it is not necessary to call this method in the scope of a TrackChangesCommand.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRange.MoveTo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the data from the current range to the range identified by the specified column and row.
member.param: The leftmost column of the target range.
The topmost row of the target range.
member.remarks: This method will raise an ArgumentOutOfRangeException exception if the target range is outside of the current worksheet.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRange.Sum
member.summary: TODO: test sum aggregation.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRange.FillData(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.FillType,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.FillDirection,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.FillDate,System.Double,System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fills the data in this range according to the current data and the specified options.
member.param: The fill type.
The fill direction.
The date component to increment when the fill type is Date. This parameter is ignored for any of the other fill types.
The increment step. This parameter is ignored if the fill type is Auto or when using linear or growth trend.
The fill restriction. The fill will stop when the running value exceeds this restriction. This parameter is ignored if the fill type is Auto or when using linear or growth trend.
A flag indicating whether to use linear or growth trend. This flag can be combined with the Linear and Growth fill types to specify the actual trend.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRange.AutoFill(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRange,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Automatically fills the values of the cells in the specified range based on the values of the cells in this range.
member.param: The range to fill.
A flag indicating whether to perform a raw copy, rather than increments/estimates.
A flag indicating the direction of the fill.
member.returns: true, if the fill was successful; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The autofill operation will fail if the specified range intersects with this range.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRange.Merge
member.summary: Merges the cells in this range into a single cell.
member.returns: true if the merge was successful; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The merge will fail if the current range contains only a single cell or if the range intersects with another merged cell.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRange.Unmerge
member.summary: Unmerges all merged cells intersecting with this range.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRange.Sort(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.SortOptions)
member.summary: Sorts the data in this range according to the specified options.
member.param: The sort settings, such as sort keys and direction.
member.returns: true if the sort was successful; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The sorting will fail if there are no keys specified or if all keys are outside of the current range.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRange.AutoFilter
member.summary: Toggles autofiltering for the columns in this range.
member.returns: true if autofiltering was successfully toggled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRange.AutoFilter(System.Int32,System.Object,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.AutoFilterOperator,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables autofiltering for the specified column in this range using the specified criteria.
member.param: The 1-based index of the column, relatively to the leftmost column in the range.

A string or an array of values, specifying the first criteria, for example "101". Use "=" to find blank fields, or use "<>" to find nonblank fields. If this argument is omitted, the criteria is All. If op is Top10Items, criteria1 specifies the number of items, for example, "10".
A value specifying the type of the filter.
The second criteria. Used with criteria1 and op to construct compound criteria.
true to display the autofilter drop-down arrow for the filtered field; false to hide the autofilter drop-down arrow for the filtered field.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Validator.Validate(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.IValidation,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Workbook,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Cell,System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified data is valid according to the specified validation criteria.

The workbook in which the validation occurs.

member.summary: Gets the list of options for this validation.
member.param: An object specifying the validation rules.
The workbook in which the validation occurs.
The cell being validated.
member.returns: A list with valid options, if this validation represents a list; otherwise, an empty list.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.MeasureUnit.Convert(System.Double,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.MeasureUnit,System.Object)
member.summary: Converts the specified value from this unit to the specified unit.
member.param: The value to convert, expressed in the current measure unit.
The target measure unit.
A parameter that is used when converting from logical units (such as inches and millimeters) to device units (such as pixels) or special units. This can be either Graphics, IGraphics, or IResolution.
member.returns: The converted value.
member.remarks: If the target represents logical unit (such as millimeter, inch, point) or a unit derived from a logical unit, and the current unit is not logical (for example pixel), the third parameter is required to perform the conversion.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.MeasureUnit.Convert(System.Double,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.MeasureUnit,System.Object,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Axis)
member.summary: Converts the specified value from this unit to the specified unit.
member.param: The value to convert, expressed in the current measure unit.
The target measure unit.
A parameter that is used when converting from logical units (such as inches and millimeters) to device units (such as pixels) or special units. This can be either Graphics, IGraphics, or IResolution.
One of the coordinate axes.
member.returns: The converted value.
member.remarks: If the target represents logical unit (such as millimeter, inch, point) or a unit derived from a logical unit, and the current unit is not logical (for example pixel), the third parameter is required to perform the conversion.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.MeasureUnit.Convert(System.Drawing.PointF,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.MeasureUnit,System.Object)
member.summary: Converts the specified point from this unit to the specified unit.
member.param: The point to convert, expressed in the current measure unit.
The target measure unit.
A parameter that is used when converting from logical units (such as inches and millimeters) to device units (such as pixels) or special units. This can be either Graphics, IGraphics, or IResolution.
member.returns: The converted point.
member.remarks: If the target represents logical unit (such as millimeter, inch, point) or a unit derived from a logical unit, and the current unit is not logical (for example pixel), the third parameter is required to perform the conversion. If both units are of the same generic type, graphics is ignored.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.MeasureUnit.Convert(System.Drawing.RectangleF,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.MeasureUnit,System.Object)
member.summary: Converts the specified rectangle from this unit to the specified unit.

The target measure unit.
A parameter that is used when converting from logical units (such as inches and millimeters) to device units (such as pixels) or special units. This can be either Graphics, IGraphics, or IResolution.
member.returns: The converted rectangle.
member.remarks: If the target represents logical unit (such as mm, inch, point) or a unit derived from a logical unit, and the current unit is not logical (for example pixel), the third parameter is required to perform the conversion. If both units are of the same generic type, graphics is ignored.

member.summary: Provides evaluation for functions and identifiers inside expressions.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.IExpressionEvaluator.EvaluateIdentifier(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.IExpressionEvaluatorContext,System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates the identifier with the specified name.
member.param: A helper object that can be used to obtain error values, invoke predefined functions, and so on.
The name of the identifier.
member.returns: A bool, double, string, DateTime, or TimeSpan value, or an error received by calling the IExpressionEvaluatorContext.GetError method. Any other value will be interpreted as the identifier not being evaluated.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.IExpressionEvaluator.InvokeFunction(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.IExpressionEvaluatorContext,System.String,System.Collections.IList)
member.summary: Invokes the function with the specified name and parameters.
member.param: A helper object that can be used to obtain error values, invoke predefined functions, and so on.
The name of the function.
The function parameters.
member.returns: A bool, double, string, DateTime, or TimeSpan value, or an error received by calling the IExpressionEvaluatorContext.GetError method. Any other value will be interpreted as the function not being invoked.
member.remarks: To interpret a parameter as a CLR value, pass the parameter to one of the following methods of the supplied IExpressionEvaluatorContext object: ToDouble, ToString, ToBool, ToDateTime, or ToTimeSpan. The context will attempt to convert the parameter to the desired type and returns null if unsuccessful. To check if a parameter is an error, call the ISERROR function of the core evaluator.

member.summary: The associated workbook.

member.summary: The underlying document.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.XmlContext.brushes
member.summary: A map of all workbook brushes.
member.remarks: During serialization, this map will contain all serialized brushes, mapped to their indices. During deserialization, the brushes are loaded from the appropriate section in the Xml file, the first time they are accessed. This list is of type (Brush, int) when serializing and of type (int, Brush) when deserializing.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.XmlContext.images
member.summary: A map of all worksheet images.
member.remarks: During serialization, this map will contain all serialized images, mapped to their indices. During deserialization, the images are loaded from the appropriate section in the Xml file, the first time they are accessed. This list is of type (Image, int) when serializing and of type (int, Image) when deserializing.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.XmlContext.sharedStrings
member.summary: When saving this map is (string => int), when loading this map is (int => string).

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.XmlContext.Version
member.summary: Gets the format revision number for the file being currently serialized.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.DataFiller.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DataFiller class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.DataFiller.Fill(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Worksheet,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRef,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.FillType,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.FillDirection,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.FillDate,System.Double,System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a data fill of the cells in the specified range, according to the specified options.
member.param: The target worksheet.
The range to be filled.
The fill type.
The fill direction.
The date component to increment when the fill type is Date. This parameter is ignored for any of the other fill types.
The increment step. This parameter is ignored if the fill type is Auto or when using linear or growth trend.
The fill restriction. The fill will stop when the running value exceeds this restriction. This parameter is ignored if the fill type is Auto or when using linear or growth trend.
A flag indicating whether to use linear or growth trend. This flag can be combined with the Linear and Growth fill types to specify the actual trend.

member.summary: Performs an automatic data fill of the cells in the specified target range, based on the data of the cells in the specified source range.
member.param: The target worksheet.
The source range.
The range to be filled.
The fill direction.
A flag indicating whether to perform a raw copy, rather than increments/estimates.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.DataFiller.AutoFill(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Worksheet,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRef,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.CellRef,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Direction,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs an automatic data fill of the cells in the specified target range, based on the data of the cells in the specified source range.
member.param: The target worksheet.
The source range.
The range to be filled.
The fill direction.

member.summary: An IExpressionEvaluator that provides implementation for the core functions and identifiers in the OpenDocument expression specification.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.CoreEvaluator.EvaluateDatabaseValues(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.EvaluationContext,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object},System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates the specified parameters as a database, database field and database criteria and returns an enumerable with the values from the database that match the criteria, or an error.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.CoreEvaluator.EvaluateDatabaseCriteria(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.EvaluationContext,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates the specified value as a database criteria. The value should be either a reference or a matrix, have width 1 and height of at least 2. The returned value is either an error or a two-dimensional array with the criteria values.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.CoreEvaluator.EvaluateDatabaseFieldIndex(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.EvaluationContext,System.Object,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.CoreEvaluator.Database,System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates the specified object as a field in the specified database and returns the 1-based index of that field. If the object is a number, returns the truncated number as an index. This method returns an error if the object is not numeric or text.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.CoreEvaluator.EvaluateParam(MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.EvaluationContext,MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.CoreEvaluator.FunctionDescriptor,System.Collections.IList,System.Int32)
member.summary: Evaluates the parameter with the specified index, based on its signature in the function descriptor. If ParameterDescriptor.Type is not null and the parameter value cannot be converted to this type, an Error is returned. If the ParameterDescriptor.Type is null, and the descriptor does not provide MissingValue or DefaultValue, this method returns null. This is the only case when this method returns null.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.CoreEvaluator.DefaultWeekends

member.summary: Standard errors.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.CoreEvaluator.FunctionDescriptor
member.summary: Defines a function signature. The function name is required. The rest of the properties may be omitted and will default to the following: { MinParams = 0, MaxParams = Constants.MaxFunctionParams, Params = {}, IsVolatile = false, IsInvariant = false, IsDynamic = false, IsAggregate = false, PropagatesErrors = true, EvaluateParams = true, StrictAggregate = true, AggregateParamType = null (Any) }.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.CoreEvaluator.FunctionDescriptor.Name

member.summary: Gets the maximum number of parameters of the function.

member.summary: Gets or sets a list with the signatures of the function parameters. A missing signature indicates the default parameter signature.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the function is invariant.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the function is volatile.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the function is dynamic.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the function will immediately return if any of its parameters evaluate to error.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.CoreEvaluator.FunctionDescriptor.EvaluateParams
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether parameters are preevaluated. Functions that short-cricuit and some other functions do not preevaluate their parameters.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the function is aggregate: SUM, AVERAGE, AND, etc.

member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter type restriction for aggregate functions.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether values that do not match the AggregateParamType cause the function to return an error or are simply ignored.

member.summary: Defines a parameter signature. Missing param descriptors are equivalent to the default descriptor: { Type = null (Any), ElementType = null, DefaultValue = null, MissingValue = null, IsScalar = true}.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ParamDescriptor class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the expected type of the parameter value or null, to accept any parameter.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the elements if the parameter value is of type Sequence. If not specified (null), the sequence can contain any elements.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value of this parameter when the parameter is omitted. This value is used for optional arguments that are not specified and for empty arguments if MissingValue is null.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value of this parameter when the parameter is empty, that is two consecutive semicolons (;;).

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.CoreEvaluator.ParamDescriptor.AllowNullValue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this parameter can be null. Usually null indicates that the parameter evaluation failed.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Spreadsheet.Expressions.CoreEvaluator.ParamDescriptor.IsScalar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the parameter expects a scalar value. This property is relevant only when Type is not set or set to Reference.
